            int main() {
                // Step 1: Read the first line

                    return 1;
                }

                    return 1;
                }

                // Compute next character

                // Now, form the string for the second program: one char and then null terminator

                int distinct = 0;

                // Traverse the string s
                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
                    unsigned char ch = s[i];
                    if (freq[ch] == 0) {
                        distinct++;
                    }
                    freq[ch]++;

                if (distinct != 2) {
                    printf("No\n");

                    int flag = 1;

                                break;
                            }
                        }
                    }
                    if (flag) {
                        printf("Yes\n");
                    } else {
                        printf("No\n");
                    }
                }

                return 0;
            }

            #include <stdio.h>

                char s[2] = { next_char, '\0' };
                int len = 1;

                int freq[256] = {0};
                int distinct = 0;

                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
                    unsigned char ch = s[i];
                    if (freq[ch] == 0) {
                        distinct++;
                    }
                    freq[ch]++;
                }

                if (distinct != 2) {
                    printf("No\n");
                } else {
                    int flag = 1;
                    for (int i = 0; i < 256; i++) {

                                break;
                            }
                        }
